name: Wulgumerang Gorge
description:
Introduction

Wulgulmerang falls Don't go during August to November as thats peregrine falcon nesting season and they nest right next to the large abseil.

This canyon is described in comprehensive detail in Canyoning Around Victoria guidebook

Approach

Approach from little river falls lookout, following the fenceline SE to Wulgulmerang creek

Descent

8 abseils, with one multipitch abseil that has longest pitch of 80m. Take 2x40m and 1x80m rope minimum. Check pool depth before jumping Don't go if there is rain forecast or there is an impending ECL.

Exit

Walk out via little river gorge There is a very faint taped track shortly before the third obligatory swim in little river gorge

Red tape

Don't tresspass. Don't follow the river in from the road.

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background
